intro: Cuphea viridostoma, commonly known as the green-stem cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple.
